TileMutatorDef.label: tar lakes
TileMutatorDef.description: A shallow pool of a dense tar-like substance. Impassable, and can't be bridged over.

TileMutatorDef.label: propane lakes
TileMutatorDef.description: Lakes of liquid hydrocarbons that seem to defy the laws of physics.

TileMutatorDef.label: magmatic quagmire
TileMutatorDef.description: A seething landscape of molten rock and blistering heat—where the ground bubbles, cracks, and burns beneath your feet.

TileMutatorDef.label: magma vents
TileMutatorDef.description: Fiery fissures in the earth that intermittently erupt with jets of molten rock and searing gas.

TileMutatorDef.label: giant fossils
TileMutatorDef.description: Gigantic skeletons of long-gone beasts litter this land.

TileMutatorDef.label: derelict clusters
TileMutatorDef.description: This area is littered with derelict mechanoid clusters, from which some materials could be scavenged.

TileMutatorDef.label: geothermal hotspots
TileMutatorDef.description: High geothermal activity allows construction of efficient geothermal plants (find them under "build biome structures" in the Furniture Architect menu).

TileMutatorDef.label: edible airborne micro-fungi
TileMutatorDef.description: Microscopic spores present in this biome can be collected and used as edible ingredients (find the collector under "build biome structures" in the Furniture Architect menu).

TileMutatorDef.label: moldy environment
TileMutatorDef.description: The ubiquitous presence of fungal spores in this region makes staying outdoors almost unbearable.

TileMutatorDef.label: oversaturated soil
TileMutatorDef.description: Fertile ground areas are even more fertile than usual.

TileMutatorDef.label: pollination frenzy
TileMutatorDef.description: Plant density is increased here due to heavy pollination, but at the risk of causing tougher allergies.

TileMutatorDef.label: petal storms
TileMutatorDef.description: Occasional flurries of flower petals that improve mood but reduce visibility.

TileMutatorDef.label: digestive surface
TileMutatorDef.description: The ground here will digest dropped items if left too long.

TileMutatorDef.label: symbiotic nutrients
TileMutatorDef.description: Simply being around this landscape makes people require 10% less nutrients to feel full.

TileMutatorDef.label: quivering surface
TileMutatorDef.description: The very ground beneath your colony trembles, pulses, and reacts—it is alive. Movement will be harder in this terrain.

TileMutatorDef.label: gelatinous memory echo
TileMutatorDef.description: The superorganism retains echoes of past events, stored like data in a living neural lattice. These memory echoes occasionally bleed into reality.

TileMutatorDef.label: ambient radiation
TileMutatorDef.description: Low levels of background radiation permeate the area, subtly affecting health and mutation rates.

TileMutatorDef.label: extreme temperature fluctuations
TileMutatorDef.description: Wild swings between scorching days and freezing nights challenge survival and crop stability.

TileMutatorDef.label: healing springs
TileMutatorDef.description: This region contains natural springs imbued with curative properties.

TileMutatorDef.label: mutagenic ocular springs
TileMutatorDef.description: This region contains weird ocular springs that mutate the body of both colonists and animals.

TileMutatorDef.label: quicksand pits
TileMutatorDef.description: This region contains pools of shallow quicksand that impede movement.

TileMutatorDef.label: residual overclocking
TileMutatorDef.description: This region still hums with the unstable energy of forgotten mechanoid infrastructure. Collectors can be built to tune into these energies (find them under "build biome structures" in the Furniture Architect menu).
